scenes.lyric: Yeah... Can't have both forever, right?
scenes.visual_description: Wide shot: Marcus sitting in driver's seat of car parked on dark street, interior lit only by dashboard glow and distant streetlights, steam rising from manhole in background, cold blue atmosphere

scenes.lyric: Phone buzzin', block hot
scenes.visual_description: Close-up: Marcus's phone screen showing multiple incoming texts, his hand holding phone, face partially visible illuminated by screen glow, cold blue light

scenes.lyric: I'm in a car with the homies
scenes.visual_description: Medium shot: Marcus in car with shadowy crew figures visible in background, hood partially up, street corner visible through window with neon signs, cold urban atmosphere

scenes.lyric: She want dates, I want digits
scenes.visual_description: Split visual: Nia sitting on bed in warm-lit apartment holding phone looking worried, contrasted with Marcus's cold street environment, visual representation of two incompatible worlds

scenes.lyric: Love in her eyes hit different
scenes.visual_description: Close-up: Nia's face illuminated by phone screen as she texts, expression showing love mixed with fear, warm amber lighting, braids framing face, eyes glistening

scenes.lyric: I'm stuck in the middle
scenes.visual_description: Medium shot: Marcus standing outside car on street corner, hands in hoodie pocket, positioned visually between two directions (trap house one way, home the other), frozen in indecision, cold blue streetlight creating dramatic shadows

scenes.lyric: Love in your arms or respect in the game
scenes.visual_description: Wide shot: Trap house entrance with blue neon glow and shadowy figures vs. warm apartment building entrance in distance, Marcus's silhouette between them, visual metaphor of the choice

scenes.lyric: I might lose your heart or my life
scenes.visual_description: Close-up: Marcus's face in car, eyes closed, hand on forehead in stress, phone buzzing in other hand, expression of anguish and internal war, blue light from phone

scenes.lyric: You say, 'Every time you leave, I feel death in the air'
scenes.visual_description: Medium shot: Nia alone in apartment, wrapped in blanket on couch, staring at door with expression of grief and fear, warm but lonely lighting, phone on lap

scenes.lyric: Gunpowder, cheap cologne, lies
scenes.visual_description: Close-up: Marcus's hoodie fabric texture, suggesting the residue of street life, perhaps his hand touching the fabric, cold atmospheric lighting

scenes.lyric: I remember when we met, I ain't have no shine
scenes.visual_description: Flashback visual: Younger Marcus and Nia on torn couch, both smiling genuinely, sitting close, warm nostalgic lighting (slightly desaturated to suggest memory), simple apartment background

scenes.lyric: Where the couch had a tear but your laugh filled the room
scenes.visual_description: Close-up flashback: Nia laughing, head tilted back, pure joy on face, Marcus's hand visible reaching toward her, warm golden nostalgic glow, the happiness before the streets

scenes.lyric: I'm stuck in the middle, tryna choose a lane
scenes.visual_description: Medium shot: Marcus sitting in car, both hands on steering wheel gripping tightly, staring ahead through windshield, jaw clenched, the physical manifestation of paralysis, dashboard glow and street lights

scenes.lyric: If I stay, do I lose my soul?
scenes.visual_description: Wide shot: Marcus standing in front of trap house, crew visible in shadows behind him, cold blue neon light, his posture showing he's with them but not of them anymore, isolated despite company

scenes.lyric: If I don't, you might never sleep
scenes.visual_description: Medium shot: Nia in bed, sitting up against headboard, phone clutched in both hands, eyes red from crying, staring at phone waiting for response, warm bedside lamp creating intimate glow

scenes.lyric: Homies say... She say... Block say... God say...
scenes.visual_description: Rapid visual: Marcus's face in extreme close-up, eyes moving as if hearing competing voices, expression shifting through emotions, phone screen glow and street light creating dramatic lighting, the moment of maximum internal conflict

scenes.lyric: I see handcuffs... I see wedding rings...
scenes.visual_description: Split or layered visual: Marcus's face with overlaid visions—one side showing cold blue (handcuffs/sirens imagery), other side showing warm gold (Nia, children, wedding imagery), the competing futures

scenes.lyric: So I text you: 'I'm done. I'm comin' home right now.'
scenes.visual_description: Close-up: Marcus's hands typing on phone screen, message visible: 'I'm done. I'm coming home right now.', his face in background slightly out of focus showing determination, phone glow illuminating scene, THE turning point

scenes.lyric: Turn the car, leave the block
scenes.visual_description: Wide shot: Car pulling away from street corner/trap house, taillights glowing red, leaving cold blue neon environment behind, steam and mist in air, visual of departure and choice made

scenes.lyric: When I walk through the door, you don't say no speech
scenes.visual_description: Medium shot: Apartment door opening, warm golden light spilling into hallway, Marcus standing in doorway (hood down, vulnerable), Nia visible inside beginning to move toward him, the moment of reunion

scenes.lyric: You just cry in my hoodie like you finally can breathe
scenes.visual_description: Close-up: Marcus and Nia in tight embrace, her face pressed into his hoodie (tears visible on fabric), his arms wrapped around her, both eyes closed, warm golden lighting, all tension released, the earned resolution

scenes.lyric: I let go so I wouldn't lose you
scenes.visual_description: Wide shot: Marcus and Nia embracing in warm-lit apartment, visible through window from outside, cold blue street in foreground now distant and separate, visual metaphor of choice complete—warmth chosen over cold

timing_notes: All scene changes aligned to downbeats for natural flow
Intro (0:00-0:12) establishes Marcus's paralysis in car
Verse 1 (0:12-0:43) introduces conflict between street life and Nia
Chorus 1 (0:43-0:70) shows Marcus stuck between two worlds
Verse 2 (0:70-1:00) deepens conflict with flashbacks to happier times
Chorus 2 (1:00-2:12) builds to maximum tension and THE decision
Scene 18 (1:49) is THE turning point - Marcus texts 'I'm coming home'
Bridge (2:12-2:20) shows the embrace - emotional release
Outro (2:20-2:29) provides visual resolution - warm vs cold
